alert.note: Alert for Ada; Boise (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 5:54PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected over the Cottonwood Creek, Hulls Gulch, and Stewart Gulch areas of the Boise Foothills. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Idaho, including the following counties, Ada and Boise. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas including burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 552 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area over burn scars. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northeastern Boise, Aldape Summit, Lucky Peak Spring Shores Marina and Lucky Peak Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
